page.title: 16RUDGWICK BRICKWORKS-LOCATION
page.content: The{RUDGWICK BRICKWORKS}is a privately owned, family-run business which began prior to the{FIRST WORLD WAR.}At that time handmade bricks were produced and fired in coke-burning{KILNS.}The works is{LOCATED}along{LYNWICK ST.}approxi- mately 1{km}from its{JUNCTION}with the {A281 GUILDFORD-HORSHAM.}The site occu- pies some{80 ACRES}of sparsely{VEGETA- {TED}land which is fringed by clumps of trees. The works also adjoins{FARMLAND and other areas of{MIXED WOODLAND}and along Lynwick St are a number of large residential premises. The land around {RUDGWICK}is composed of thin layers of top soil and clay which, in{SUSSEX}is named{WEALDEN CLAY.}Although this soil is 'heavy' for local{GARDENERS}it pro- vides the brickworks with a good{RAW- {MATERIAL.}It is{ESTIMATED}that present brick-clay supplies will be sufficient to{MANUFACTURE}bricks for{20 YEARS.
